summaryText: Wow, what an incredible message about love from Pastor Travis Hearn! Today, PT dives deep into 1 Corinthians 13, exploring what true, godly love really looks like. Isn't it amazing how we often misunderstand love as something sentimental or passive? Pastor Travis breaks down love as an active, intentional choice that transforms not just individuals, but entire communities and even the world! He reminds us that love isn't about what we get, but what we give - just like God demonstrated through Jesus Christ. The sermon challenges us to look beyond our own comfort and self-interest, revealing that love is patient, kind, and humble. Can you imagine how different our world would be if we truly loved like God loves? Pastor Travis powerfully illustrates that love isn't a feeling, but a decision - a daily commitment to put others first, to show compassion, and to see humanity through God's eyes. Whether it's being patient with someone's growth, showing kindness without expecting anything in return, or remaining humble in a world that celebrates pride, this message is a radical call to love like Jesus.
mainPoints: Love is patient and kind, not self-seeking
True love is selfless, not about personal gain
Love requires humility and putting others first

versesMentioned.text: Dear friends, let us continue to love one another, for love comes from God. Anyone who loves is a child of God and knows God. Anyone who does not love does not know God, for God is love.

Jesus replied: 'Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind.' This is the first and greatest commandment. And the second is like it: 'Love your neighbor as yourself.'

If I speak in the tongues of men or of angels, but do not have love, I am only a resounding gong or a clanging cymbal. If I have the gift of prophecy and can fathom all mysteries and all knowledge, and if I have a faith that can move mountains, but do not have love, I am nothing. If I give all I possess to the poor and give over my body to hardship that I may boast, but do not have love, I gain nothing.
My dear brothers and sisters, take note of this: Everyone should be quick to listen, slow to speak and slow to become angry.
Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit. Rather, in humility value others above yourselves, not looking to your own interests but each of you to the interests of the others.

Monday.scripture: 1 Corinthians 13:4: 'Love is patient, love is kind.'
Monday.action: Identify one relationship where you struggle with patience. Write down three specific ways you can show more grace and understanding this week.
Monday.prayer: Lord, teach me to be patient and kind, just as You are patient with me. Help me see others through Your eyes of love and compassion. Amen.

Tuesday.scripture: Ephesians 4:2: 'Be completely humble and gentle; be patient, bearing with one another in love.'
Tuesday.action: Look for an opportunity to put someone else's needs before your own. This could be listening without interrupting, offering help without being asked, or giving up something you want.
Tuesday.prayer: God, help me decrease so that You may increase. Give me a humble heart that seeks to serve others rather than be served. Amen.

Wednesday.scripture: Proverbs 10:12: 'Hatred stirs up conflict, but love covers over all wrongs.'
Wednesday.action: Reflect on a current relationship tension. Instead of defending yourself, ask God how you can respond with love and understanding.
Wednesday.prayer: Father, help me be an agent of Your love and reconciliation. Give me wisdom to respond with grace, not anger. Amen.

Thursday.scripture: 1 Peter 4:8: 'Above all, love each other deeply, because love covers over a multitude of sins.'
Thursday.action: Reach out to someone who has hurt you in the past. Offer forgiveness or simply send a message of kindness.
Thursday.prayer: Lord, help me love like You love - unconditionally and without keeping score. Teach me to forgive as I have been forgiven. Amen.

Friday.scripture: Romans 12:10: 'Be devoted to one another in love. Honor one another above yourselves.'
Friday.action: Perform a random act of kindness for someone without expecting anything in return. Do something completely unexpected and thoughtful.
Friday.prayer: God, make me an instrument of Your love. Help me see opportunities to show Your kindness to others today. Amen.

Saturday.scripture: Galatians 5:22-23: 'But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness, gentleness and self-control.'
Saturday.focus: Cultivating love as a spiritual discipline
Saturday.action: Spend time reflecting on the different aspects of love mentioned in today's sermon. Journal about how you can grow in each area.
Saturday.prayer: Holy Spirit, continue to shape my heart to reflect Your love. Help me grow in patience, kindness, and humility. Make me more like Jesus. Amen.
